docs.lead_paragraph: American high school students are not as physically fit in the 1990's as they were in the aerobicized 1980's, and only 37 percent of them say they exercise regularly, a study has found. While fewer than half of teen-agers reported engaging in at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise three or more times a week, down from 60 percent in the mid-1980's, one-third said they spent three or more hours watching television each school day, researchers reported.
